title: JP Morgan Logo : what font is it?
content:
Does anyone know what font the new JP Morgan logo is in?

[http://www.jpmorgan.com/images/logo\_jpm\_2008.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203601/http:/www.jpmorgan.com/images/logo_jpm_2008.gif "http://www.jpmorgan.com/images/logo\_jpm\_2008.gif")

Thank you!!!!!
author: acarroll

comments.content: Wow, one logo style that is going in the reverse direction: older. Maybe a new trend. Looks like a customized [Baskerville](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203601/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=baskerville&sample_text=JPMorgan&sample_size=48).

_older_

Though the spacing looks more like a net domain name than anything else.

I would have said a custom font as well. My first instinct was baskerville of some kind, although some of the serifs are reminiscent of a Bodoni. That might reflect one of the older JP Morgan wordmarks that was based on Bodoni.

Good to see them try to differentiate themselves from the Chase retail banking side.
